course.subject: MGMT
course.name: Human Resources Management
course.description: Manpower planning, job analysis and design, recruitment, performance appraisal, compensation, training and development, health and safety at work and discrimination.

reviews.author: littlepear
reviews.title: Good grade with little workload
reviews.comment_teaching: He is experienced in the HR field but the content is boring and the participation is based on IPRS only, so people did not speak up even he asked questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
1. Test x2
Test 1 (mean: 32.4 sd:?   me: 37.9)
Test 2 (mean: 37.0 sd: 6.33  me: 43.33)
Final grade: A

2. Group project
Although he wrote group project is graded as "pass or fail", the final score is calculated in %!

3. Interview exercise
You'll get full mark as long as you are present

4. IPRS
Around 5 questions each class

5. Individual case report x3
A summary of the case and apply sth you learnt from class

6. Attendance in present days
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not heavy. No need to spend much efforts in doing the group project as you can expect all groups actually receive similar grades. The only differentiator is the test. Even though it is close-booked, you just need to spend 2-3 days on it.

reviews.author: zebra
reviews.title: Quite an easy course
reviews.comment_content:
See for yourself, if the topics sound interesting to you, go for it. I personally think it's a nice course where the knowledge you learn is more or less the same in real life.
1) Intro to HRM
2) Legal and Ethical Issues in HRM
3) Strategic HRM
4) Job Analysis
5) Recruitment
6) Selection
7) Interviews
8) Performance appraisal
9) Training Employees
10) Legal Requirements
11) Incentive Pay
12) Managing HRM globally
reviews.comment_teaching:
- We had a 3-hour lecture every week, prof doesn't give us breaks but he lets us go in and out of the room as we like.
- Very attentive to questions.
- He tries to make the lecture funny with the sound effects on the powerpoint (might seem childish but does lighten the atmosphere)
reviews.comment_grading:
1) There are 3 individual case reports. All of them are based on pass or fail, so as long as you do it, you'll get full marks. (Tho also means your grade depends on other assignments)
2) Commenting on canvas during other groups' presentation (you can just bs)
3) Group presentation (actually just the verbal version of the case report with more details)
4) Test
5) Mock interview (between peers)

My points:
1) 100%
2) 100%
3) Unknown
4) MC (37/50) Mean (38.5/50)
    Short essay Q (3/6) Mean (2.5/6)
5) 100%
---------> Got B in the end

p.s. I forgot if iprs also counts
reviews.comment_workload:
- Since most of the assignments are based on pass or fail, I would say it is really light.
- Tho, the 1st slot of presentations is in Sep (which is the deadline of those who do not present and write the individual presentation instead).
- The test wasn't that hard I suppose, at least there weren't tricky questions. But you might find it hard to grasp the skill for answering the short essay question cuz he doesn't teach you how to do it.

reviews.author: cossie
reviews.comment_teaching:
Provide handout each lessons and discuss your opinion next lecture.
He is encouraging and interactive, there are around 15 mins provided at the beginning for us to share some latest issues.
The last 30 mins is used to discuss some issues in group and then present our ideas to class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair
He wants us to contribute more in class, therefore class participation is important coz all gp in our class got 30-32 out of 40.

25% Participation
25% Group project 1 (written report)
25% Group project 2 (only presentation is needed)
25% Integrated test

i finally got a B.
Integrated test: cancelled
Participation: attend all class but very passive in class
Group project 1: 31/40 (our gp is so "hea", and did it in the last day)
Group project 2: dont know
reviews.comment_workload: No mid term and exam. Only need to attend all class coz attendance is required and you need to give opinion every lesson in order to let him to remember you. Group project is not difficult in my opinion. 8 pages with double spacing for the 1st project and around 10 mins present for the 2nd project (only 2 group members allowed to present)

reviews.author: Moksh
reviews.title: Excellent Course and Excellent Professor
reviews.comment_content: Content was fairly straightforward but was well explained during lesson by professor. Just like any other MGMT course, the course was basic and taught about the fundamentals of Human Resources.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Mark was a great professor who made the lesson interesting with various segments and a lot of group activities that got the class to know everyone even while the semester was online. He made sure he gave everyone a chance to participate at least once in class.
reviews.comment_grading: There was no final exam but two group projects. One was a report while the other was a presentation. While they accounted for a majority of the grade, participation was 25% and an essay exam at the lesson. Overall I received an A and the grading I believe was done very fairly.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not too intense for a 4 credit course, but it is important to review all content before lesson and collaborate effectively with your group to complete tasks on time.

reviews.author: lonelyguy
reviews.comment_content:
Pretty basic and straightforward HR stuff. Quite interesting and useful if you have passion in HR. The content is designed in an organized way so it is quite easy to follow. Not bad!

Module 1: Introduction and HRM Fundamental
Ch.0: Course orientation
Ch.1: Introduction to HRM
Ch.2: Law and Ethics
Ch.3: Strategic HRM

Module 2: Recruitment and Selection
Ch.4: Job Analysis
Ch.5: HR Planning and Recruiting
Ch.6: Testing and Selection
Ch.7: Interview

Module 3: Performance Appraisal and Training
Ch.8: Performance Appraisal
Ch.9: Training Employee

Module 4: Compensation and Global HRM
Ch.10: Establish Pay Structure
Ch.11: Rewarding Performance
Ch.12: Global HRM
reviews.comment_teaching:
He is experienced in HR as his research topic is related to HRM, plus he has taught this course for many years already. He definitely has sufficient knowledge of HR. He is also the department head so his experience may help a bit.

His PowerPoint is very easy to follow and concise. It makes my revision much easier. However, since it is a 3-hour class, sometimes we all got bored easily due to his talking speed and no break in between (although he ends classes earlier as a compensation). His PowerPoint has those sound effects which are quite embarrassing but somehow funny.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good Grade! His grading is definitely better than Mark, at least it is more transparent.

His grading scheme is super complicated and trivial.
65% 2 Tests
16.3%: Individual & Team Participation (Presentation, class exercises etc.)
17.3%: Case Reports
1.4% Presentation Day Attendance

Due to social conflicts, the % allocation is changed to:
40% Test 1: barely above 1 SD (Mean; 48.7/66, SD: 6)
28% Individual & Team Participation: unknown
29% Individual Written Case Report: 29/29
3% Attendance on Case Presentation Days: 3/3

Grade: A

His grading distribution is as follows:
A range: 17%-25%
B range: 35%-45%
C range: 28%-38%
reviews.comment_workload:
- 2 Exams (Non-cumulative)
- 1 Presentation which is graded P/F (case study)
- 1 interview exercise
- several class exercises
- 3 case reports, graded P/F again (topics that you are not presenting)

I love his P/F grading policy so that it reduces the workload for the project and the case reports. As long as we complete the presentation and case reports probably and submit it on time, full credit will be granted. No big deal.

But at the same time, it makes it harder to differentiate our performance. The 2 exams are the major grade differentiator as the rest of the grading components are too easy to get full score. Overall, not too heavy in terms of workload.

reviews.author: Doris雯雯
reviews.comment_content: There are a lot of management concepts, I think the contents are easy to understand but may not be very useful.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching is interesting. He has many interactions with students and encourage students to talk in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
25% Integrated test
25% participation
25% Project 1 (written report)
25% Project 2 (presentation)
Actually I think the the grading is not transparent enough because I don't know my marks from the second project, integrated test and the participation (I don't even know how he grades the participation) but overall I got a satisfactory grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is fine for me, there are two projects and one integrated test, memorising the class materials is not necessary because the integrated test is an open-book test. The projects are not really giving heavy workload because you will have a lot of group members. Overall it is fine for me and when compared with other courses.

reviews.author: Jinsenjinny
reviews.comment_content:
3 Hr class may seem boring on paper. But he breaks it down into like 1h20mins lecture and 1h20 mins activity like group discussion or group activity.

Like his Ethics class, he always starts the class with world news , then go through the assigned readings and lecture notes for the day.

Pretty chill content, but he only teaches the content that are rather important , if u want more information, you better read the whole book on your own.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He is a very friendly and nice teacher, always encouraging student's participation. He goes through what we are supposed to read from the book and articles and always give his opinion over some matters.
However it may be boring over time as it is always the same format, which may explains a lot of reviews saying how boring it could be. But since it is a 3hr class, it is in fact actually maybe 1h20mins lecture, and then the other half is just group discussion or an activity related to the topic we are doing. It can be very fun and less boring if you are active and willing to participate.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is fair, cause most of the assignments are team-related. And final exam is an essay. So it is quite subjective.
There is also participation and the whole class is mostly based on active participation. If u are willing to participate, then u can expect fair grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Since it is only a one class per week, a lot of self-reading is expected from the book. Mark also assigns a weekly reading (Article and from book). But apart from readings, there isn't any homework or assignments to turn in except project, so overall it is pretty light (you can choose not to read actually xd)

reviews.author: qasazx
reviews.comment_content:
A basic hrm course, but the content is useless
Didn't learn something new from the course,it designed poorly
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is very boring, it had one 3-hour  lecture per week, half of the time was teaching lecture notes and the other half was discussion
reviews.comment_grading:
it was not a good decision to take in spring Sem
I have heard that Mark was new professor to this course , I don't know whether other professor would give better grade. But from my experience (I have also taught by Mark in Year 1's Sbmt course), Mark's grading was really poor. Also, his grading was not clear. I don't know the grade of my group's final project and the grade of the integrated test.
reviews.comment_workload:
Its workload is acceptable
participation + group project + integrated test at last lesson
the integrated test is about writing an essay, it is open notes
group project include a writing report and a presentation, our group have seven people so workload is not that high

reviews.author: DontSearchMe
reviews.title: Boring but quite good grade!
reviews.comment_content: The content is not so about HRM in reality. It is about HRM in management level, or in terms of management. So please manage your expectation of the course before registering the course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Mainland prof boring af. People just sit there and mind their own business. He tries to make the class fun but asking questions and saying jokes. no response...
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is good for me.
My midterm and final sucks, below >=1 sd but still have B
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is average. He will divide you into groups after the add drop. But if you are the first 3 groups, you only have a few days to prepare your group presentation and find your groupmates lol
And you have case studies to do but they are easy, just rmb to rephrase

reviews.author: Krispy
reviews.title: Useful Content, Boring Professor
reviews.comment_content: Content is very useful and somewhat interesting if you're interested in HR. It's related to psychology and also focuses on some management principles. You'll learn about what HR managers do and how to compensate workers fairly.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is a nice and extremely friendly guy, BUT his classes are really boring. You'll get bored really fast as he relies heavily on his powerpoint slides and drones on about an idea just to convey a point. The annoying part about his lecture slides is that he leaves out some parts or leaves blanks in his slides to get you to pay attention to his lecture and fill-in-the-blanks. So if you're planning to ditch, make sure you have someone to help you jot down the important notes.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is quite alright. He takes participation via in-class exercises and PRS questions. His PRS questions are similar to the type of MCQ he'll give in his exams.
reviews.comment_workload: Quite light workload. You'll have to do 3 case write-ups, and 1 group presentation on a case. It is very straightforward and easy to handle. The exams are also very straightforward. You'll do alright as long as you read your notes and understand the concepts.

Not much

reviews.author: yccc
reviews.title: the teaching sucks
reviews.comment_content: Basic introduction to Human Resource Management.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching was boring as his English accent made you really sleepy. Communicating with him sucks for he didn't seem to get your point everytime you talked to him, and he would answer your questions in a long and dull way.
But I cannot deny that he is trying to give help to every student approaching him.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading on group presentation was harsh.

For the exams, you must get very familiar with the lecture notes to secure a fair grade for it.

reviews.author: csyip
reviews.title: Good professor and good course
reviews.comment_content: The content is all about HRM practices, like training and development, global HRM etc. If you are interested in HRM, it is a good course for you.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is a very friendly and nice professor who patiently answers your questions and queries.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is quite good. Maybe around 26-27% A range. As long as you attend lectures and do revision before quizzes, you should get a decent grade.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not that heavy, with two quizzes, 4 take-home assignments, some in-class exercises, and a mini project.  For the take-home assignments, as long as you complete that, you can easily get full marks

reviews.author: bkirs
reviews.title: Nice if you are interested in HR
reviews.comment_content: All about HR practices. He mentioned introductory issues concerning laws and ethics and strategic HRM. Then, he talked in detail about recruitment and selection, performance appraisal and training, and compensation. Finally, he also spoke of global HRM. Interestingly, he loved using his 4 cases as examples and applying them in different topics.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is nice and easy-going. He is willing to listen to students' opinions and change the course requirements accordingly. Some complained that they didn't have enough time in the mid-term exam so he extended the time limit in the final exam by 15 minutes. He usually answered questions quite efficiently and in detail. However, you may find the course boring if you're not interested in the topics because of his voice. He sometimes tended to read directly from the ppt.
reviews.comment_grading: I do think his grading policy is good. I got full marks in all the reports and my scores in both quizzes were 1 SD above the mean. I got A-range finally. (He did't say much about our performance in participation)
reviews.comment_workload: There were a total of 4 cases, one of which was a team-based project presentation, and the remaining were to be read individually. You had to write a 3-page report for each of them. Although he said he would either give you a full mark or zero mark, most of the students could get full marks. Some people might have their reports deducted few marks though. Basically you just have to attend all lectures because he counted participation heavily by PRS and in-class group exercises. There were at least 2 - 3 PRS questions almost every class. But on balance I would say it is not difficult to handle.

reviews.author: ChingChongCheng
reviews.title: Brush har grade lor, sleep har in class lor
reviews.comment_content: Only writing this because I don't think some of the reviews (for 2017-2018 fall sem) are fair. Yes, the professor is boring and the lecture content is pretty much useless (not like I was expecting anything else, I was only taking it just in case I cannot graduate because it was a core course and I knew in Spring sem 2017 the MGMT department suddenly cancelled the other core course), but it is pretty good grade IMO (as long as you ain't dumb).
reviews.comment_teaching:
Yeah professor is boring but that's why you can exploit this and get good grade. Bunch of half-wits don't listen in class so if you pay a bit of attention on important parts (stories and fill in the blanks as mentioned in my 'Grading' part), you should be able to get at least an A-range.

And just to be fair to the professor, he is boring but by no means is he a prick. I have seen professors worse than him. He is by far the most lenient and chill professor I have seen. it's just that the students are as good as dead and won't be willing to answer any questions, so don't just blame it on the professor (although I wasn't the ones who answer question either, but hey I got a decent grade out of it)
reviews.comment_grading:
There are plenty of course components, but then most of them can be satisfied by simply submitting your assignments and attending classes.

As you can see in the attached syllabus, around 26.45% of the total grade can be achieved by handing in assignments (doubt he reads it I spent like 30 minutes bs-ing) and attending classes (PRS). There are bunch of idiots who managed to submit the work late and lose some points here and there (or miss the PRS... whatever).

There is this presentation that may or may not matter, I was in the first batch of groups to present, which means I had less than one week to prepare the presentation. We hea did our presentation (honestly, less than 1 hour of work from everyone) and it was still better than most people (got like 0.2 marks off highest?).

Main differentiator is the mid term and final. Both are just MC and short essay questions, non-cumulative. MCs are only tricky because sometimes he will ask a question on some 'stories' he tells in class, so whenever he said he has a story, just listen up and jot down the details (won't be in the slides). Also try to look at where he left blanks in the slides and fill it in when he goes through it in class. Otherwise, don't bother listening, not like HRM is complicated anyways, everything is common sense in MGMT. Short questions ain't too bad, in the final he simply used the same question as one of the ones he put in the lecture slides, so I guess just make sure you look at them also.

I got 45/50 (3 marks off high i guess? Mean was like 40, SD like 4.5+?) in mid term, dunno about final but final grade A+. So for the reviews that blame it on bad grading even though you guys got 1SD above mean in mid term, you can suck it, you obviously f**ked it in the final.
reviews.comment_workload:
Easy. Even if you have to hard carry the presentation I don't think it's that bad (leave yourself around 3 days to do the presentation is enough --> Our PowerPoints are filled with bullet points.

For mid term and final, just revise a bit beforehand. Pretty good to brush grade from my point of view (obviously you might read other reviews and think otherwise).
